SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: To present a case of aortic dissection in a pregnant woman with Marfan's syndrome
CLINICAL FEATURES: A 34-year-old woman with Marfan's syndrome developed gestational hypertension and Type III aortic dissection during the third trimester
The diagnosis was confirmed by computed tomography and aortography
OUTCOME: Although the dissection progressed, the woman was treated successfully
At follow-up the dissection had healed
CONCLUSION: Marfan's syndrome introduces a high risk of aortic dissection during pregnancy and the treatment chosen is crucial
As dilatation of the aorta is progressive, patients with Marfan's syndrome should be followed up closely and offered prophylactic surgery if necessary
